Title: AI Engineer
Description:
AI Engineer

Location: Berlin/Hybrid




We are seeking a talented and driven AI Engineer to join fast-growing AI start-up, REMATIQ. This is an exciting opportunity to work on cutting-edge AI solutions that are transforming regulatory affairs. As a AI Engineer, you will take ownership of designing, building, and scaling machine learning systems that drive impactful innovation in the industry.




Responsibilities

Collaborate with cross-functional teams to design, develop, and deploy machine learning models into production.
Build and optimize scalable and efficient machine learning pipelines for data processing, model training, and deployment.
Lead efforts in identifying, implementing, and validating the best algorithms and techniques for solving business challenges.
Take ownership of model performance, monitoring, and continuous improvement in production.
Mentor junior team members and contribute to fostering a collaborative engineering culture.
Research and stay up-to-date on advancements in machine learning, MLOps, and related technologies.
Contribute to the development of best practices in model lifecycle management, including reproducibility and version control.




Requirements

Proven experience as a Machine Learning Engineer or AI Engineer in a similar role, with expertise in Python.
Strong track record of delivering production-grade machine learning systems, including model deployment and monitoring.
Proficiency in at least one of the following areas:
Data Science: Advanced analytics, statistical modeling, and insights generation.
MLOps: Building robust CI/CD pipelines for machine learning workflows and automation.
Large Language Models (LLMs): Fine-tuning, training, or deploying state-of-the-art transformer-based models.
Natural Language Processing (NLP): Developing applications like text classification, summarization, or entity recognition.
Hands-on experience with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, GCP, Azure) and containerization tools (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes).
Strong problem-solving skills with the ability to prioritize tasks effectively in a fast-paced environment.
Familiarity with scalable data storage and processing systems (e.g., Spark, Hadoop, or similar).
Passion for leveraging AI to revolutionize regulatory affairs.




Nice-to-Have Skills

Experience working in an early-stage start-up
Familiarity with regulatory affairs or compliance-related applications.
Contributions to open-source machine learning projects.
Expertise in deep learning frameworks such as TensorFlow or PyTorch.
Strong software engineering practices, including code reviews, testing, and documentation.




Why Join Us?

Innovative Mission: Be part of transforming regulatory affairs with cutting-edge AI technology.
Impactful Role: Take ownership of significant projects and contribute to shaping the future of the industry.
Collaborative Environment: Work with a small, ambitious team where everyone has real ownership over the product and company.
Growth Opportunities: Learn and grow in a fast-paced start-up environment with continuous professional development.
Compensation: Competitive salary and a generous equity package for early employees..




Join REMATIQ and be a driving force in revolutionizing regulatory affairs through AI. If you are a passionate and skilled AI Engineer ready to make an impact, we’d love to hear from you!

Show more
HTML:
AI Engineer

Location: Berlin/Hybrid


We are seeking a talented and driven AI Engineer to join fast-growing AI start-up, REMATIQ. This is an exciting opportunity to work on cutting-edge AI solutions that are transforming regulatory affairs. As a AI Engineer, you will take ownership of designing, building, and scaling machine learning systems that drive impactful innovation in the industry.


Responsibilities

  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to design, develop, and deploy machine learning models into production.
  • Build and optimize scalable and efficient machine learning pipelines for data processing, model training, and deployment.
  • Lead efforts in identifying, implementing, and validating the best algorithms and techniques for solving business challenges.
  • Take ownership of model performance, monitoring, and continuous improvement in production.
  • Mentor junior team members and contribute to fostering a collaborative engineering culture.
  • Research and stay up-to-date on advancements in machine learning, MLOps, and related technologies.
  • Contribute to the development of best practices in model lifecycle management, including reproducibility and version control.


Requirements

  • Proven experience as a Machine Learning Engineer or AI Engineer in a similar role, with expertise in Python.
  • Strong track record of delivering production-grade machine learning systems, including model deployment and monitoring.
  • Proficiency in at least one of the following areas:
  • Data Science: Advanced analytics, statistical modeling, and insights generation.
  • MLOps: Building robust CI/CD pipelines for machine learning workflows and automation.
  • Large Language Models (LLMs): Fine-tuning, training, or deploying state-of-the-art transformer-based models.
  • Natural Language Processing (NLP): Developing applications like text classification, summarization, or entity recognition.
  • Hands-on experience with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, GCP, Azure) and containerization tools (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes).
  • Strong problem-solving skills with the ability to prioritize tasks effectively in a fast-paced environment.
  • Familiarity with scalable data storage and processing systems (e.g., Spark, Hadoop, or similar).
  • Passion for leveraging AI to revolutionize regulatory affairs.


Nice-to-Have Skills

  • Experience working in an early-stage start-up
  • Familiarity with regulatory affairs or compliance-related applications.
  • Contributions to open-source machine learning projects.
  • Expertise in deep learning frameworks such as TensorFlow or PyTorch.
  • Strong software engineering practices, including code reviews, testing, and documentation.


Why Join Us?

  • Innovative Mission: Be part of transforming regulatory affairs with cutting-edge AI technology.
  • Impactful Role: Take ownership of significant projects and contribute to shaping the future of the industry.
  • Collaborative Environment: Work with a small, ambitious team where everyone has real ownership over the product and company.
  • Growth Opportunities: Learn and grow in a fast-paced start-up environment with continuous professional development.
  • Compensation: Competitive salary and a generous equity package for early employees..


Join REMATIQ and be a driving force in revolutionizing regulatory affairs through AI. If you are a passionate and skilled AI Engineer ready to make an impact, we’d love to hear from you!

Title: Data Scientist (m/f/x)
Description:
Job Description

We at sevdesk:

As an intuitive cloud accounting software, we empower founders, self-employed individuals, and small business owners to focus on what truly matters. Our product offers them a smart accounting tool to save time in their daily activities. As a company, we aim for excellence, continuously expand our horizons, and strive for daily improvement of our product and our daily work life. In pursuit of these goals, we rely on our strong culture, innovative spirit, and unwavering passion. In the future, we hope to count you among our dedicated team members.

Your Mission:

As a Data Scientist in our Data Team, you simplify accounting processes for our customers by designing and implementing practical machine learning solutions that address real-world problems and deliver significant value for our users and our company. You collaborate with Product and ML engineering to seamlessly integrate your models into production systems.

Here's how you'll make an impact:


You ensure scalability, reliability and maintainability of ML solutions by following best practices.
You combine and clean data, perform complex analyses, and apply modern ML and deep learning algorithms to identify data patterns.
You develop a proof-of-concepts with product teams and business units to demonstrate the added value of your solutions.
You translate domain-specific problems into mathematical and technical requirements and explain complex relationships simply.
You enjoy to mentor and guide junior team members, fostering a culture of continuous learning and improvement.


Your Qualification:


You hold a degree in mathematics, a technical field or a related discipline, with 3-5 years of relevant professional experience as a Data Scientist.
You have profound knowledge in machine learning/deep learning, statistical analysis and in developing business cases for data science products.
You are proficient in SQL/NoSQL, Python and common ML libraries (e.g., scikit-learn, pandas, numpy, PyTorch).
You understand typical challenges in developing and providing Data Science products and the pros and cons of various ML/DL algorithms.
You are confident with software development best practices, container technologies (such as Docker) and cloud platforms.
You write clean, modular, and testable code, moving beyond Jupyter notebooks to production-quality solutions.


Our Tech Stack

AWS | Python | Dagster | Terraform | Dbt | Snowflake | Github | Containers | Traditional ML & GenAI models


Experience with these tools is a plus, but we value your ability to design and implement systems with similar tools and discuss design trade-offs in each product category, possibly suggesting improvements to our stack.


Job Requirements

Your sevdesk Experience

Drive Impact: Make meaningful contributions and help move initiatives forward across teams. Your input will be valued, and your work will have a direct influence on sevdesk's success.

Empowered Ownership: take charge of your work and projects with the expectation of making decisions independently, supported by a team that's there when you need guidance.

Competitive Compensation: Includes a stock option plan and company pension to reward your contributions.

Time to Recharge: 30 vacation days, 3 additional days for social engagement, plus 30 Workation days to work from anywhere in the EU.

Flexible Work Environment: We believe in working where you’re most productive, whether that’s at home or in the office. Our hybrid approach balances flexibility with in-person collaboration, fostering trust and strong teamwork when we come together.

Comprehensive Benefits: learning budget, bike leasing, monthly voucher of choice (Amazon, IKEA, Car Sharing, …), Amazon book flat, corporate discounts and more.

Team Vibes: Enjoy regular team offsites and quarterly events packed with networking and fun!





For more insights, visit us on Instagram



Contact:   Marc Riehle


Show more

Title: (Senior) Machine Learning Scientist (f/m/d)
Description:
We are Kineo, a Berlin-based tech startup developing machine learning solutions that bring real, tangible business value to our clients. Through our expertise, mindset, culture and most importantly with your help we are turning the AI landscape upside down. Are you excited to contribute to meaningful, impactful projects?




Our proposition to you





We vouch to create a space where you can explore different sets of complex problems and data across industries and verticals.


To support you in your personal development, everyone at Kineo has a mentor. When you grow, so does Kineo.


Your decisions matter! You will not have a boss who decides things for you. At Kineo we believe that decisions are best made locally, by the people closest to the problem at hand.


Transparent salary and career planning from day one.


A beautiful office in the centre of Kreuzberg, with tons of benefits, such as free drinks, snacks, consoles etc.


28 days of vacation


A shared revenue model - when Kineo does well, you will benefit financially, too





Success in the role means that you will have





After 2 months: You established yourself as a member of the team and have already contributed to one of our client projects. You have a clear understanding of how we work and can independently navigate our technical architecture.


After 6 months: You are a key member of the team and fully involved in the development of a client project. You will have made notable contributions to our codebase and internal processes.


After 12-24 months: In collaboration with internal science and engineering resources, you lead the development of a client-facing application from the workshop phase to production. You are a trusted expert in a wide variety of machine learning algorithms and you are able to transfer that knowledge to more junior members of the team.





Your Character Traits





You want to achieve something and don't need a "manager" to tell you that. You are eager to have space to take responsibility and grow from that.


You enjoy exploring beyond your immediate tasks and are open to learning new skills. You collaborate across different areas to help the team succeed, even in areas outside your main expertise.


You are a strong communicator with the ability to present ideas clearly and collaborate effectively. You value building positive relationships and working together to achieve shared goals.





You fit in with our team culture if you





Enjoy working in an environment that combines pragmatic, commercial thinking with a strong desire to learn and grow together. We value team players that are curious but convey humility and respect for different opinions.


You actively choose to work in a start-up, with all the ups and downs.


See open feedback, accountability and independent thinking as the foundation for exceptional (team) work.


You embrace Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion. You are excited to contribute to an environment where different perspectives are celebrated, and you actively participate in fostering awareness and continuous learning around DEI.



Tasks



You will work as part of smaller teams of 2-3 people on developing machine learning solutions with our clients.


You will conceptualize and implement algorithmic solutions to challenging business problems. This includes prototyping and productionizing of machine learning solutions, and also defining and analysing product use cases together with the customer.


You will own machine learning solutions from the first drop of raw data, all the way into production serving millions of inference requests.



Requirements



An advanced quantitative degree - e.g Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science or related fields. Strong knowledge of theoretical math and CS.


At least two years of work experience as Data Scientist or Machine Learning Engineer.


Knowledge of working with large structured and unstructured data sets. Knowledge of data engineering tools like Apache Spark is an advantage.


Strong programming skills in Python. We love other languages too, but Python is what we (and you) will use.


We are AI Consultants - ask yourself: Do you want to be a Consultant?


Experience in using a wide range of ML frameworks such as SKLearn, Tensorflow, Torch in production. Experience with domain specific libraries like OpenCV, HuggingFace etc are an advantage.


Good written and verbal communication in both English and German. Most of our clients are German speaking so a level of at least B2 is required for the role.


Resident in Germany. Due to the size of the company, we cannot currently accept applications from other EU/non-EU countries.





We explicitly do not hire anyone who discriminates against people on the basis of religion, national origin, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, marital status or other aspects. We encourage people from LGBTQIA+ and other underrepresented groups to apply.




Last but not least, keep in mind that we are hiring value based, not skill based. That being said, please tell us the following in your contact message:





Why we would love to work with you


Why you want to work with us
Show more

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Company: SR2 | Socially Responsible Recruitment | Certified B Corporation™
Description:
SR2 are partnered with a global consultancy who are looking for Data Science specialists.




In this role, you will leverage your expertise in data analysis and statistical modeling to help clients uncover trends, patterns, and insights from their data. You will work on projects involving data collection, cleaning, visualization, and interpretation, turning complex datasets into actionable insights that inform business strategy. The ideal candidate will have strong analytical skills, proficiency in programming languages like Python or R, and experience with data visualisation and statistical techniques.




Requirements:

Bachelor’s or Master’s in Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or a related field.
Proficient in Python and data analysis libraries such as Pandas, NumPy, or scikit-learn.
Familiar with cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, or GCP.
Experience with Databricks is essential.
Strong problem-solving, critical thinking, and communication skills.




Role

6-12+ month contract with high probability of extension
Hybrid with occasional travel to Munich
Candidates have to be based in Germany
2x Stage interview process




If you're passionate about using data to solve real-world business challenges, we'd love to hear from you.

Title: Data Scientist - Consumer (Global Discovery)
Description:
About The Opportunity

We are on the lookout for a Data Scientist to join the Search & Ranking team within consumer discovery on our journey to always deliver amazing experiences.


Develop and Optimize Search Algorithms: Enhance and research new search machine learning algorithms, such as learning to rank, semantic search, and personalization, to deliver the most relevant results to our users.
Collaborate Across Teams: Work as part of a cross-functional team, including Backend Engineers, Product Managers, and Data Engineers, to improve our global search end-2-end.
Analyze and interpret large datasets: Extract meaningful insights to understand relevance problems.
Innovate and Experiment: Identify and apply the best machine learning and statistical methods to solve complex problems, ensuring solutions are scalable and effective in production environments.
Navigate Ambiguity: Define and tackle data science problems amidst ambiguity, ensuring clear problem definitions and actionable insights


At Delivery Hero, you’ll shape the global consumer experience for millions of users. Your work will have a direct impact on how we attract and retain customers, creating data-driven, personalized interactions that keep them coming back. As part of our Consumer Team, you’ll enhance customer satisfaction and drive global growth and profitability through innovative projects.

What you need to be successful


Experience: Master’s degree (or Bachelor’s with 4+ years of work experience) in a quantitative field such as Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics, Theoretical Chemistry, or similar. 2+ years of experience as a data scientist working on applying data science fundamentals to solve complex business problems
Technical Expertise: Proficiency in SQL and Python and its ML ecosystem is essential. Experience with Java and Scala is a plus.
Machine Learning Knowledge: Strong understanding of a wide variety of ML and statistical methods, including Classical ML, Deep Learning, NLP, and Recommendation Systems. Ability to discern the most suitable approach for different problems.
Search and Ranking ML Algorithms: Hands-on experience with search machine learning algorithms, such as learning to rank, semantic search, and personalization.
Problem-Solving: Comfortable with ambiguity and capable of navigating it to define clear data science problems and solutions. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a focus on delivering practical solutions.
Collaborative Spirit: Proven experience working in cross-functional teams, contributing effectively to joint projects and achieving common goals. Excellent communication skills to articulate complex ideas and influence stakeholders.


Who we are

As the world’s pioneering local delivery platform, our mission is to deliver an amazing experience, fast, easy, and to your door. We operate in over 70+ countries worldwide, powered by tech, designed by people. As one of Europe’s largest tech platforms, headquartered in Berlin, Germany. Delivery Hero has been listed on the Frankfurt Stock Exchange since 2017 and is part of the MDAX stock market index. We enable creative minds to deliver solutions that create impact within our ecosystem. We move fast, take action and adapt. No matter where you're from or what you believe in, we build, we deliver, we lead. We are Delivery Hero.

What's in it for you

Ensuring you and all our Heroes are looked after, happy, and healthy is always on the menu. Because if you’re in good shape, then we’re in good shape.


Make the most of our hybrid working model and join the team for face-to-face connection and collaboration in our beautiful Berlin campus 2 days a week
We offer 27 days holiday with an extra day on 2nd and 3rd year of service
We will support you in developing yourself and your career growth opportunities: 1.000 € Educational Budget, Language Courses, Parental Support and access to the Udemy Business platform to explore a variety of online courses.
Get moving and release those wonderful, mind-boosting endorphins: Health Checkups, Meditation, Yoga, Gym & Bicycle Subsidy
Cash. Dough. Cheddar. Whatever you call it, we’ll help you with it: Employee Share Purchase Plan, Sabbatical Bank, Public Transportation Ticket Discount, Life & Accident Insurance, Corporate Pension Plan
The power of getting together over some food is unrivaled. Here are a few ways to help you do that. All the yum: Digital Meal Vouchers, Food Vouchers, Corporate Discounts. Courses.


Ready to join our team? If you’re excited to grow, collaborate and be part of the world’s leading delivery platform, we’d love to hear from you. Apply today!

We believe diversity and inclusion are key to creating not only an exciting product, but also an amazing customer and employee experience. Fostering this starts with hiring - therefore we do not discriminate on the basis of racial identities, religious beliefs, color, national origin, gender identities or expressions, sexual orientations, age, marital or disability statuses, or any other aspect that makes you, you. We encourage you to let us know if you need any accommodations or specific accessibility support to ensure a smooth interview experience—just include it in your application. You're welcome to share your pronouns (he/she/they) right from the start so we can address you respectfully from our first contact.

Title: AI Data Scientist - Relocate To Saudi Arabia
Description:
Please note that this role is based in Saudi Arabia on a permanent, residential basis.







Job Req ID: 15496




Description:

Aramco energizes the world economy.

Aramco occupies a unique position in the global energy industry. We are the world's largest producer of hydrocarbons (oil and gas), with the lowest upstream carbon intensity of any major producer.

With our significant investment in technology and infrastructure, we strive to maximize the value of the energy we produce for the world along with a commitment to enhance Aramco’s value to society.

Headquartered in the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia, and with offices around the world, we combine market discipline with a generations’ spanning view of the future, born of our nine decades experience as responsible stewards of the Kingdom’s vast hydrocarbon resources. This responsibility has driven us to deliver significant societal and economic benefits to not just the Kingdom, but also to a vast number of communities, economies, and countries that rely on the vital and reliable energy that we supply.

We are one of the most profitable companies in the world, as well as amongst the top five global companies by market capitalization.







Overview




We are seeking a Data Scientist to join our Artificial Intelligence and Analytics Organization (AI&A).




AI&A, within our Digital transformation office, is dedicated to realizing business added value from leveraging the latest technological advancements of Artificial Intelligence (AI) and analytics. We are a center of excellence in Saudi Aramco for Artificial Intelligence technologies and data science.




Your primary role is to identify potential value from data, formulate AI and data science ideas and conceptualize them.







Key Responsibilities




As the successful candidate you will be required to perform the following:

Work with stakeholders throughout the organization to identify opportunities for leveraging company data to drive business solutions.
Mine and analyze data from company data sources to drive optimization and improvement of product development, and business strategies.
Assess the effectiveness and accuracy of new data sources and data gathering techniques.
Develop custom data models and algorithms to apply to datasets.
Support ideation endeavors in packaging new ideas/products and preparing them for minimal viable product development.
Assess AI applicability in enhancing current business processes.







Minimum Requirements




As the successful candidate you must hold a Master of Science or PhD degree in data science, computer science, computer vision, applied mathematics or a related field.
You must have a minimum of 8 years of hands-on experience in Data Science & AI projects (Generative AI, Computer Vision, Natural Language Processing (NLP), Time Series). Experience in the energy sector is a plus.
You must be able to demonstrate experience of bringing ideas from conceptualization to productionalization using the right tools (e.g. mlflow, Kubeflow, tensorlight, etc.).
You must also be able to showcase a very strong expertise in data collection, cleaning, and preprocessing, and wrangling.
You should be fluent in either R, or Python; both is preferred, and familiarity with Golang is a plus.
You should have at least 5 years of experience in building computer vision-based product.
You should be able to apply transfer learning on models like, VGG16, LeNet, ResNet, AlexNet, etc.
You must be proficient in deep learning tools keras, TensorFlow, pytorch, cafee, OpenCV and/or dlib, and scikit-image.
You must be able to build object detection models, face/gesture recognition, and identification engines.
You should be experienced in Information Retrieval (Content Recommendation, Search Metrics, Search Query, document classification, entity recognition, topic modelling, etc.).
You should be proficient in transfer learning and in fine tuning open-sourced models like BERT.
You should have least 5 years of experience in building time series forecasting models.
You should be expert in time series forecasting models and in using technologies like LSTMs, Prophet, and time series analysis.
You should be proficient in using sklearn pandas, NumPy, plotly, seaborn, and relevant R libraries if R is their preferred language.







Working environment

Our high-performing employees are drawn by the challenging and rewarding professional, technical and industrial opportunities we offer, and are remunerated accordingly.

At Aramco, our people work on truly world-scale projects, supported by investment in capital and technology that is second to none. And because, as a global energy company, we are faced with addressing some of the world’s biggest technical, logistical and environmental challenges, we invest heavily in talent development.

We have a proud history of educating and training our workforce over many decades. Employees at all levels are encouraged to improve their sector-specific knowledge and competencies through our workforce development programs – one of the largest in the world.




Country/Region: SA

HTML:
Please note that this role is based in Saudi Arabia on a permanent, residential basis.



Job Req ID: 15496


Description:

Aramco energizes the world economy.

Aramco occupies a unique position in the global energy industry. We are the world's largest producer of hydrocarbons (oil and gas), with the lowest upstream carbon intensity of any major producer.

With our significant investment in technology and infrastructure, we strive to maximize the value of the energy we produce for the world along with a commitment to enhance Aramco’s value to society.

Headquartered in the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia, and with offices around the world, we combine market discipline with a generations’ spanning view of the future, born of our nine decades experience as responsible stewards of the Kingdom’s vast hydrocarbon resources. This responsibility has driven us to deliver significant societal and economic benefits to not just the Kingdom, but also to a vast number of communities, economies, and countries that rely on the vital and reliable energy that we supply.

We are one of the most profitable companies in the world, as well as amongst the top five global companies by market capitalization.



Overview


We are seeking a Data Scientist to join our Artificial Intelligence and Analytics Organization (AI&A).


AI&A, within our Digital transformation office, is dedicated to realizing business added value from leveraging the latest technological advancements of Artificial Intelligence (AI) and analytics. We are a center of excellence in Saudi Aramco for Artificial Intelligence technologies and data science.


Your primary role is to identify potential value from data, formulate AI and data science ideas and conceptualize them.



Key Responsibilities


As the successful candidate you will be required to perform the following:

  • Work with stakeholders throughout the organization to identify opportunities for leveraging company data to drive business solutions.
  • Mine and analyze data from company data sources to drive optimization and improvement of product development, and business strategies.
  • Assess the effectiveness and accuracy of new data sources and data gathering techniques.
  • Develop custom data models and algorithms to apply to datasets.
  • Support ideation endeavors in packaging new ideas/products and preparing them for minimal viable product development.
  • Assess AI applicability in enhancing current business processes.



Minimum Requirements


  • As the successful candidate you must hold a Master of Science or PhD degree in data science, computer science, computer vision, applied mathematics or a related field.
  • You must have a minimum of 8 years of hands-on experience in Data Science & AI projects (Generative AI, Computer Vision, Natural Language Processing (NLP), Time Series). Experience in the energy sector is a plus.

  • You should have at least 5 years of experience in building computer vision-based product.

  • You must be able to build object detection models, face/gesture recognition, and identification engines.
  • You should be experienced in Information Retrieval (Content Recommendation, Search Metrics, Search Query, document classification, entity recognition, topic modelling, etc.).
  • You should be proficient in transfer learning and in fine tuning open-sourced models like BERT.
  • You should have least 5 years of experience in building time series forecasting models.
  • You should be expert in time series forecasting models and in using technologies like LSTMs, Prophet, and time series analysis.
  • You should be proficient in using sklearn pandas, NumPy, plotly, seaborn, and relevant R libraries if R is their preferred language.



Working environment

Our high-performing employees are drawn by the challenging and rewarding professional, technical and industrial opportunities we offer, and are remunerated accordingly.

At Aramco, our people work on truly world-scale projects, supported by investment in capital and technology that is second to none. And because, as a global energy company, we are faced with addressing some of the world’s biggest technical, logistical and environmental challenges, we invest heavily in talent development.

We have a proud history of educating and training our workforce over many decades. Employees at all levels are encouraged to improve their sector-specific knowledge and competencies through our workforce development programs – one of the largest in the world.


Country/Region: SA

Title: AI / Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Job Description

Are you a passionate AI/ML Engineer looking to make a significant impact in a dynamic and innovative environment? Join our team and be at the forefront of AI-driven transformation!

About The Team

Data is the fuel that keeps our world moving, and we at Natuvion are experts in moving large quantities of it. We are a small team of computer science experts dedicated to accelerating data transformation, making it more efficient, pleasant, and secure. Essentially, we operate as a startup within a well-established company. Our team members hold advanced degrees in computer engineering, logic, physics, and related fields, fostering a culture of deep technical expertise and continuous learning. We pride ourselves on our fast-paced development, strong team culture, and open, focused communication.

Why Join Us?


Innovative Projects: Work on designing and implementing fascinating projects like implementing a programming language in conjunction with cutting-edge AI applications.
Collaborative Environment: Be part of a team that values open communication and collaboration, where your ideas and contributions are highly valued.
Cutting-Edge Technology: Engage with the latest advancements in AI and machine learning, and apply them to real-world problems.
Professional Growth: Benefit from a culture that encourages continuous learning and professional development.



Your Responsibilities


Design, develop, and deploy AI models and algorithms to solve complex problems and enhance our products.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand requirements and deliver AI solutions that meet business needs.
Conduct data preprocessing and feature engineering to prepare data for modeling.
Implement and optimize AI techniques such as semantic search, NLP, and recommendation systems.
Ensure code quality and scalability through the use of typing tools like mypy and pyright.
Generate comprehensive documentation and presentations to communicate findings and solutions.
Analyze current AI scenarios, identify gaps, and discuss implementation possibilities with other engineers and stakeholders.
Stay up-to-date with the latest advancements in AI and machine learning to continuously improve our solutions.



Job requirements

Core Skills


Deep Learning and Machine Learning: Proficiency in frameworks like TensorFlow, PyTorch, and scikit-learn.
Large Language Models (LLMs): Understanding of current models and their applications.
AI Techniques and Applications: Experience with various AI techniques such as semantic search, natural language processing (NLP), and recommendation systems.
Programming Skills: Proficiency in Python, with a strong emphasis on scalable and understandable code using typing tools like mypy and pyright. Familiarity with Haskell is a plus.
Data Preprocessing and Feature Engineering: Expertise in preparing and transforming raw data into suitable formats for modeling.
Documentation and Presentation: Ability to generate comprehensive documentation and presentations.
Collaboration and Communication: Strong interpersonal skills to work effectively within the team and with other stakeholders.
Analyzing AI Scenarios: Ability to analyze the current basis for specific AI scenarios like Automatic Data Analysis, Root Cause Identification, Mapping Rule Generation, and other relevant areas for large scale data transformations. Identify gaps and discuss implementation possibilities with other engineers and stakeholders.



About Our Core Products


DCS (Data Conversion Server): An orchestration engine for designing, executing, and monitoring data transformation workflows within SAP systems.
Compose: A programming language for DCS that enables bidirectional compilation, allowing DCS content to be converted into Compose code and vice versa, facilitating version control, continuous integration, and more.



What You Can Expect From Us

An environment that is always open to change and optimization. There is no such thing as “that's the way it's always been” with us. You have the chance to contribute your knowledge, shape processes, standardize existing topics or optimize workflows. Be a driving force and take us even further with your expertise!

We Create An Environment In Which You Feel Comfortable


Home office contracts
Permanent employment and 30 days' vacation
Trust-based working hours - work in a way that best suits your everyday life and our customers
Mentoring program - a good induction according to your needs for an optimal start with us
#teamgreen - An internal network of experienced experts for mutual exchange and the joint development of solutions to problems
An appreciative employee culture, flat hierarchies, short communication channels and an open-door policy - a team that supports and inspires each other!
Regular team events and workshops on site
With our new health benefit 'Nilo' you get 10 free therapy sessions a year and can use the app for meditations, lessons and courses - all for your well-being!
Further training is a priority



Join #teamgreen - Natuvion is a digital moving company.

Our team doesn't move desks, filing cabinets or chairs. Natuvion moves business-critical data and processes from one technology platform to another. Typical Natuvion “relocation services” include data migration, data transformation, data integration, data protection, data security and data quality.

Our >400 consultants and developers in Germany, Austria, Slovakia, the USA and Australia have extensive expertise in (SAP®) projects and a profound understanding of processes across industry boundaries. With a great deal of experience, commitment and dedication, they support our customers with consulting, services and our own software technology. In this way, we enable companies to use their data and processes on the most modern and innovative platforms at all times.

Join us and be a part of a team that is at the forefront of AI innovation, driving transformation and delivering value to our clients and partners. If you are passionate about AI and eager to make an impact, we would love to hear from you

Title: Artificial Intelligence Engineer
Description:
Title: AI Engineer




Location : Remote in Germany (preferably Berlin)




Salary : 65k-100k +




Join Europe's Fastest-Growing EdTech Platform!

Are you passionate about AI and its transformative power in education we're reimagining education with AI.




Role Overview:

As an AI Engineer, you’ll take full ownership of developing and refining our AI product, working across both backend and AI systems. You’ll help us shape the future of personalized learning while working alongside a talented, high-growth team of engineers and product specialists.




Key Responsibilities:

Own the development of AI-powered tutors, focusing on improving metrics and user experience.
Work end-to-end: from AI discovery and product development to implementation and testing.
Collaborate closely with product, backend, and frontend teams to make a big impact.
Lead and innovate in AI development, driving continuous improvement in the product.




Must-Have Skills:

Strong understanding of AI (doesn’t need professional experience, but a solid grasp of the basics).
Experience building side projects or contributing to AI initiatives (academic projects count!).
Passion for AI and its potential impact on education.
A self-starter who thrives in a fast-paced, high-growth environment.
Understanding of product development and how to impact business outcomes.




Nice-to-Have Skills:

Experience with full-stack development (able to contribute across backend and frontend).
Familiarity with product impact metrics: growth, retention, and monetization.




What We Offer:

Equity (ESOP) options to share in the company’s success.
Benefits: Urban Sports Club, team events, development budgets, and more!
Remote work: Hybrid model with a travel budget for team workations.

Title: Staff Machine Learning Research Scientist (d/f/m)
Description:
Why us?

We believe that AI has the potential to revolutionize how cancer and other complex diseases are diagnosed and treated. We also believe that AI is a tool, not an identity – without access to high-quality data and a scientifically rigorous, transparent approach to model development, AI is just a buzzword. That's where we come in.

Aignostics is a spin-off from one of Europe's largest and most prestigious university hospitals (Charité), with employees in Berlin and New York. We have received over $50M in funding from leading investors and are a growing team of over 100 interdisciplinary professionals. We work with academic partners as well as leading global life sciences companies.

As a Staff Machine Learning Research Scientist at Aignostics, you will play a crucial role in shaping the scientific and technical direction and integrity of our data science platform, projects, and products. You will work hand in hand with our collaborators in academia and industry to push the state of the art for digital pathology. Your expertise will be instrumental in driving scientific and technical excellence across all data science teams, ensuring we deliver high-quality, scalable solutions that transform complex biomedical data into actionable insights for cancer research and diagnostics..

This is a unique opportunity to join a fun, diverse, and growing team of 100+ machine learners, software engineers, applied scientists, pathologists, and biologists to shape the next generation of cancer treatments. You will be part of a driven community that works in an agile, supportive, and interdisciplinary research environment where your results make a difference to patients. In our established startup, you have the opportunity to grow personally and technically, take on significant responsibilities, and benefit from a dynamic work environment.

Data Science or Machine Learning? We do both at Aignostics, and are convinced that both are needed for success. You can expect to work on a broad spectrum of topics from deep learning with foundation and other state-of-the-art models on terabytes of data to projects in low sample regimes and very high-dimensional and multimodal data. We have nearly all the data science challenges you can think of for you!

At Aignostics, we believe that fighting cancer is a job for people of all identities, backgrounds, and cultures. We value and celebrate diversity and inclusion and are committed to offering equal employment and promotion opportunities for all applicants and employees. Applicants will be considered regardless of their age, disability, ethnicity, race, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, religion, etc. We thrive through collaboration and believe the more inclusive we are, the better our work will be.

Where your expertise is needed


You identify promising new directions based on the scientific literature, results from in-house experiments, and your own novel ideas.
You are able to turn these ideas into reality by describing, presenting, designing, implementing, and experimenting with novel machine learning architectures, models, and variants of existing models
You analyze experiments that you and others run, and form ideas and hypotheses to explain results
You run large-scale distributed machine learning experiments
You work with the Staff Data Science team and with other teams involved in machine learning and translational research
You resolve technical difficulties that arise as part of the data science and machine learning work
You develop ideas about our data science and machine learning strategy, and how this relates to business objectives, so as to provide a competitive advantage
You develop ideas about product management on technical and scientific feasibility and risks of complex product features
You contribute to technical and scientific design, planning, and integration of our platform across systems and algorithms
You provide technical and scientific guidance in data science model, algorithm, and system design reviews
Educate mid-level and junior ML researchers and data scientists to bring them up to the next level
Demonstrate long-term thinking and utmost technical and scientific excellence in your individual contributions
Support data science teams in maintaining up-to-date, high-quality documentation and code


What We Are Looking For


Demonstrated research excellence, as demonstrated by your scientific track record: peer-reviewed publications in relevant journals and at relevant conferences
Proven track record of driving technical and scientific excellence and innovation
Expertise in: pathology machine learning, foundation models, and robust medical machine learning models
Deep understanding of what it means and takes to apply machine learning in the medical domain
Extensive knowledge and understanding of relevant deep learning models
Knowledge of the medical and/or biological domain is a highly valuable additional qualification
Excellent communicative skills, able to articulate complex technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders
You are a team player who gets enthusiastic when your contributions drive the team ahead
Extensive experience with designing, setting up, running, monitoring and evaluating (i) large-scale distributed machine learning trainings, (ii) multimodal machine learning, or (iii) robust machine learning products; 6+ years of experience with this
Advanced degree in Machine Learning, Computer Science, Statistics, Physics, Mathematics, or a related field that provides sufficient technical background to perform state of the art machine learning research
Extensive experience with machine learning and statistical concepts, including advanced topics such as self-supervised learning, foundation models, representation learning, explainable AI (XAI), multimodal models
Knowledge and routine application of best practices in software engineering, software architecture, and clean coding
Solid understanding of cloud technologies (GCP, AWS), containerization and orchestration (Kubernetes, Ray)


Ideally, you also:


Contribute to open-source projects and scientific publications
Have experience with large scale data processing systems such as Ray, Spark, etc.
Extensive expertise in multiple programming languages and frameworks is a plus
Worked in a regulated environment, e.g. financial services, aerospace, or healthcare
Have knowledge of digital pathology or medical imaging
Have experience with biomedical data processing and analysis


We are still keen to hear from you if you don't match all the above points! Our needs are diverse and growing, and you are encouraged to apply if you have a strong combination of these skills.

Our offer


Join a purpose-driven startup: We are working collectively to fight cancer and improve patient outcomes. Come help us make a difference!
Cutting-edge AI research and development, with involvement of Charité, LMU Munich, TU Berlin, and our other partners
Work with a welcoming, diverse, and highly international team of colleagues
Opportunity to take significant responsibility and grow your role within the startup
Expand your skills by benefitting from our Learning & Development yearly budget of 1,000€ (plus 2 L&D days), language classes and internal development programs
Mentoring program, where you'll learn from and mentor great experts
Flexible working hours and teleworking policy
Enjoy your well-deserved time off with 28 paid vacation days per year
We are family & pet friendly and support flexible parental leave options
Pick a subsidized membership of your choice among public transport, sports, and well-being
Enjoy our social gatherings, lunches, and off-site events for a fun and inclusive work environment


Join us to make a difference in the fight against cancer!

About Us

aignostics.com
Show more

Our offer

  • Join a purpose-driven startup: We are working collectively to fight cancer and improve patient outcomes. Come help us make a difference!
  • Cutting-edge AI research and development, with involvement of Charité, LMU Munich, TU Berlin, and our other partners
  • Work with a welcoming, diverse, and highly international team of colleagues
  • Opportunity to take significant responsibility and grow your role within the startup
  • Expand your skills by benefitting from our Learning & Development yearly budget of 1,000€ (plus 2 L&D days), language classes and internal development programs
  • Mentoring program, where you'll learn from and mentor great experts
  • Flexible working hours and teleworking policy
  • Enjoy your well-deserved time off with 28 paid vacation days per year
  • We are family & pet friendly and support flexible parental leave options
  • Pick a subsidized membership of your choice among public transport, sports, and well-being
  • Enjoy our social gatherings, lunches, and off-site events for a fun and inclusive work environment

Join us to make a difference in the fight against cancer!

About Us

aignostics.com

Title: Back End Developer
Description:
Job Opportunity: Senior Backend Engineer (Berlin, Germany)




Location: Berlin, On-site with flexible work-from-home options available




Salary: €85,000 annually + equity




About Us:

We are a fast-growing startup focused on revolutionizing the customer experience in the e-commerce space through AI-powered messaging. Our platform integrates seamlessly with e-commerce platforms, offering cutting-edge chatbots and virtual assistants that help brands connect with customers. As we expand rapidly, we are looking for a Senior Backend Engineer to join our team and help shape the future of our innovative product.




The Role:

As a Senior Backend Engineer, you will take ownership of building and maintaining the backend infrastructure that powers our AI-driven e-commerce platform. You’ll work closely with frontend engineers and AI teams to ensure smooth integration between the customer-facing application and the backend systems. The ideal candidate is someone who thrives in a fast-paced environment and enjoys working on impactful, large-scale backend solutions.




Key Responsibilities:

Backend Development & Support: Work on the backend system to ensure smooth functionality for the e-commerce platform. This includes working on tracking and messaging structures.
AI Integration: Contribute to the development and integration of our AI-powered solutions, such as chatbots and virtual assistants.
E-commerce Focus: Build scalable backend solutions for messaging and AI integrations tailored to e-commerce environments.
Collaborate with Frontend Team: Ensure seamless communication between backend and frontend systems, working closely with the frontend engineers.
Team Contribution: Collaborate within a small, dynamic team, taking ownership of backend features and helping mentor junior engineers as we expand.




Must-Have Skills:

TypeScript (Node.js): Strong expertise in backend development using TypeScript with Node.js.
E-commerce Experience: Prior experience in developing backend systems for e-commerce platforms, ideally with a focus on messaging or AI-powered applications.
AI & Messaging Experience: Familiarity with building backend systems that support AI-driven tools or messaging platforms like WhatsApp, Instagram, etc.
English Communication: Proficiency in English for communication with the team and clients.
Senior-level Experience: Significant backend engineering experience, particularly with building scalable and maintainable systems.




Future Projects:

E-commerce AI Agents: Work on developing AI agents for e-commerce platforms, focusing on messaging and customer engagement through popular platforms like Instagram and WhatsApp.
Onsite Helpers: Contribute to the development of AI-powered helpers, similar to Clippy, for e-commerce websites.




Why Join Us:

Ownership: You’ll have a direct impact on the evolution of our product and play a critical role in shaping the future of e-commerce AI.
Fun Environment: A casual, collaborative culture with opportunities for team activities like bowling, Nintendo Switch games, and classes.
Career Growth: Strong potential for leadership growth as the company expands.
Innovation: Work on cutting-edge AI and messaging platforms that are changing the future of online shopping.




What We Offer:

Competitive salary: €85k annually, with potential salary increases post-funding.
Equity Options: 0.5-0.75% equity for senior candidates.
Flexible Work Arrangements: Office-based in Berlin with some remote work flexibility.
Visa and Relocation Support: Visa sponsorship and a relocation package (up to €1-3k) available.
BVG Card and Leasing Scheme: Get support for transportation and bike leasing.




If you're passionate about backend engineering and want to be part of a growing, innovative team in the e-commerce and AI space, we’d love to hear from you. Apply now and join us in building the future of e-commerce!

This version focuses on backend responsibilities, the technical stack, and projects with an emphasis on AI, e-commerce, and messaging systems. Let me know if you'd like any changes!

Title: AI Frontend Engineer (f/m/d)
Description:
Overview

At Aleph Alpha, we are shaping the future of AI with European values at the core. The heart of our product is developing cutting-edge generative AI solutions with a strong emphasis on sovereignty, ethical development, and societal benefit. Our generative AI offering empowers businesses, governments, and individuals to achieve their full potential.

Team

To bring our vision to life, we work closely with our partners to unlock the transformative power of generative AI. Our Customer Team empowers them by leveraging Aleph Alpha’s sovereign solution stack, ensuring they can harness AI’s full potential with confidence and security.

As our AI Frontend Engineer, you will bridge the gap between theoretical AI models and practical, scalable solutions tailored to specific business needs of our customers. You will work closely with Engineering and Product to  help them shape a stable production environment.

Your Responsibilities


Develop and maintain user-facing web applications and interactive interfaces using JavaScript/TypeScript, HTML, and CSS ensuring high performance and scalability.
Write clean, maintainable, and efficient code following industry best practices and modern development standards.
Advocate for and implement coding standards, performance optimizations, and best practices to improve code quality and maintainability.
Identify, debug, and resolve frontend issues to ensure smooth application functionality and an optimal user experience.
Implement and maintain automated testing strategies for frontend components to enhance reliability and reduce regressions.
Collaborate with Engineering, Product, and Design teams to align technical solutions with business goals and user needs.
Apply responsive design principles to create intuitive and seamless user experiences across various devices and screen sizes.


Your profile


Proficiency in JavaScript or TypeScript, along with HTML and CSS.
Expertise in modern frontend frameworks such as Vue.js or React.js, with experience in building responsive and high-performance web applications.
Solid experience in customer-facing technical projects or solution implementation.
Proficiency with Git, version control, and automated testing frameworks (e.g., Jest, Cypress).
Excellent problem-solving skills and experience managing complex projects throughout their life cycle.
A good understanding of machine learning concepts and algorithms is a plus.
Familiarity with Python for AI/ML integration and the ability to incorporate AI models into frontend applications.
Fluency in English is required, and proficiency in German is highly preferred.


What You Can Expect From Us


Become part of an AI revolution!
30 days of paid vacation
Access to a variety of fitness & wellness offerings via Wellhub
Mental health support through nilo.health
JobRad® Bike Lease
Substantially subsidized company pension plan for your future security
Subsidized Germany-wide transportation ticket
Budget for additional technical equipment
Flexible working hours for better work-life balance and hybrid working model
Virtual Stock Option Plan
Show more

Title: Data Scientist (m/w/d) in den Bereichen NLP und LLM
Description:
Die DIN Solutions GmbH steht innerhalb der DIN-Gruppe für eine hohe technische Expertise und ist verantwortlich für die Entwicklung und den Betrieb von Software, Plattformen und Datenbanken. Unsere Aufgabe ist es, (Kunden-)Anforderungen in technische Lösungen zu übersetzen. Darüber hinaus entwickeln wir Lösungen für Normenanwender und Kooperationspartner der DIN-Gruppe.

Wir suchen ab sofort in Berlin - unbefristet -

Data Scientist (m/w/d) in den Bereichen NLP und LLM

Aufgaben

Wir Suchen Einen Data Scientist (m/w/d) In Den Bereichen Natural Language Processing (NLP) Und Large Language Models (LLM). In Dieser Rolle Unterstützt Du Unser Team Bei Der Entwicklung Und Anwendung Von NLP- Und LLM-Technologien Zusammen Mit Weiteren Erfahrenen Kolleg*innen. Du Erhältst Die Gelegenheit, In Einem Dynamischen Und Kreativen Umfeld Der Normung Und Normen-Anwendung Zu Arbeiten Und Dich Im Bereich Der Natürlichen Sprachverarbeitung Zu Verwirklichen. Folgende Aufgaben Erwarten Dich


Entwicklung von KI-Assistenten für Normen-Anwender und innerbetriebliche Prozesse der DIN-Gruppe mithilfe von Large Language Models (LLMs) und Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG)
Anwendung von Natural Language Processing (NLP) Methoden, Anpassung von Machine Learning Modellen und LLMs, um Wissen aus Normen-Daten automatisch zu extrahieren und zu strukturieren
Planung, Entwicklung, Betrieb und Optimierung von Infrastrukturen mit Hilfe von DevOps, LLMOps, und Cloud-Diensten, um die Bereitstellung und den Betrieb zukünftiger KI-Lösungen sicherzustellen
Arbeiten in interdisziplinären Teams, um Entwicklungen in bestehende und neue Produkte und Lösungen der DIN Media zu integrieren
Entwicklung von Prototypen und Bewertung von Technologien, die als Grundlage für neue und innovative Produkte und Lösungen dienen
Projektmanagement und Projektsupport für KI-Projekte mit externen Dienstleistern
Mitarbeit in DIN- und KI-Netzwerken und die Unterstützung bei DIN-gruppenweitem Wissensaufbau im Bereich Künstliche Intelligenz


Profil


Erfolgreich abgeschlossenes wissenschaftliches Hochschulstudium (Diplom, Master) in Informatik, Wirtschaftsinformatik, Computerlinguistik, Software Engineering, Data Engineering, Mathematik oder vergleichbarer Fachrichtung
Sehr gute Programmierkenntnisse in Python und Erfahrung mit ML-Frameworks (z. B. TensorFlow, PyTorch, spaCy, LangChain, LlamaIndex) und Data-Science-Toolsets (z. B. pandas, numpy, scikit-learn)
Praktische Erfahrung mit Machine Learning, insbesondere mit neuronalen Netzwerken, Large Language Models (LLMs) und der Verarbeitung und Analyse großer Datenmengen
Praktische Erfahrung mit Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG), Vektordatenbanken und/oder der Anpassung von Open Source LLMs auf domänenspezifischen Anwendungen
Erfahrung mit DevOps-Praktiken (z. B. GitLab, Docker, CI/CD, Kubernetes) im Allgemeinen und MLOps/LLMOps im Speziellen, sowie mit Cloud Infrastrukturen (z.B. Azure AI, AKS)
Kenntnisse in der Erstellung und Nutzung von Wissensgraphen sowie Erfahrung im Ontologie-Lernen sind wünschenswert
Fundierte Erfahrung im Projektmanagement und Netzwerken
Sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse


Wir bieten


35 Std./Woche (Vollzeit)
Maxi-Flex-Modell: Möglichkeit der Anhebung der Wochenarbeitszeit auf bis zu 42 Std./Woche
Flexible Arbeitszeiten (Gleitzeitmodell mit Kernarbeitszeit 10:00 - 14:00 Uhr)
Mobiles Arbeiten möglich
30 Tage Jahresurlaub sowie Betriebsferien zwischen Weihnachten und Neujahr
Ein top modernisiertes Gebäude in zentraler Lage (Wittenbergplatz/Zoologischer Garten)
Kostenfreie Nutzung des hauseigenen Physiozentrums, Zuschuss zum VBB-Firmenticket, JobRad, Sabbatical, Betriebsrestaurant mit bezuschusstem Essen, betriebliche Altersvorsorge etc.
Umfassende und strukturierte Einarbeitung und Betreuung


Important note

Please be advised that a valid work permit for Germany is required for non-EU citizens. Unfortunately, applications without a valid work permit and sufficient German language skills may not be considered.

LNKD1_DE

  • Mobiles Arbeiten möglich
  • 30 Tage Jahresurlaub sowie Betriebsferien zwischen Weihnachten und Neujahr
  • Ein top modernisiertes Gebäude in zentraler Lage (Wittenbergplatz/Zoologischer Garten)
  • Kostenfreie Nutzung des hauseigenen Physiozentrums, Zuschuss zum VBB-Firmenticket, JobRad, Sabbatical, Betriebsrestaurant mit bezuschusstem Essen, betriebliche Altersvorsorge etc.
  • Umfassende und strukturierte Einarbeitung und Betreuung

Title: Data Scientist - Insights (Payments) | Paid relocation to Barcelona, Spain
Description:
We power people's progress.

At Preply, we’re all about creating life-changing learning experiences. We help people discover the magic of the perfect tutor, craft a personalized learning journey, and stay motivated to keep growing. Our approach is human-led, tech-enabled - and it’s creating real impact. So far, 90,000 tutors have delivered over 20 million lessons to learners in more than 175 countries. Every Preply lesson sparks change, fuels ambition, and drives progress that matters.




Meet the team!

At Preply, data is at the heart of every decision we make. We run hundreds of A/B tests to continually optimize our product, each with its own analytical and tracking challenges. The complexity of our subscription model, along with the unique dynamics of tutor-learner interactions, offer an exciting opportunity for those looking to make a real impact.

As a Data Scientist for the Payments Operations (PayOps) team, you will play a crucial role in optimizing our payments ecosystem and driving our monetization strategy forward. Embedded within a cross-functional squad, you’ll collaborate closely with product managers, tech leads, designers, and other key stakeholders to deliver data-driven insights that shape business decisions. Your work will focus on analyzing and improving payment workflows, including checkouts, pay-ins, and payouts, to ensure a seamless experience for our students and tutors alike.




Our Data Team is dedicated to empowering top-quality decision-making. Do you want to know how? Visit our Tech Radar to learn about the technologies we use at Preply!




What You’ll Be Doing

Analyze data related to payment processes, including pay-ins and payouts, to uncover insights and identify opportunities for optimization.
Monitor transaction performance to detect and troubleshoot anomalies in payment flows (e.g., failed transactions, latency issues, fraud patterns).
Collaborate with product, engineering, and finance teams to improve payment flows, reduce transaction failures, and optimize processing times.
Provide payment performance deep-dives per region to detect optimizations / opportunities.
Conduct A/B tests analysis to evaluate the impact of changes in payment flows.
Provide actionable insights to reduce costs, increase payment success rates, and improve user satisfaction with payment-related services.
Identify trends and opportunities, providing actionable insights to support team initiatives.
Stay updated on industry trends, payment technologies, and competitive practices to inform strategic decisions.




What You Need To Succeed

At least 5 years' experience in Data Science, focusing on data analytics for product or payment teams.
Previous experience in a dynamic technology environment, preferably within payments, e-commerce, or the fintech space.
Proven ability to work with product teams, run A/B tests, and identify product and payment optimization opportunities.
Strong background in quantitative fields (e.g., statistics, mathematics).
Proficiency in one or more programming languages (e.g., SQL, Python).
An outcome-driven approach with a passion for problem-solving and exploring new ideas.
A creative mindset with a proactive attitude, along with stakeholder management and influencing skills;
Ability to create clear, insightful reports and dashboards.
Fluency in English and eager to work on a global product with a multicultural team.




Nice To Have

Familiarity with payment gateways, transaction processing, digital wallet systems and PSD2 or regional regulations.
Experience with Looker, Amplitude, Snowflake.
Experience with advanced statistical modeling, predictive analytics or machine learning.
Experience in digital businesses and checkout steps (B2B, B2C, B2B2C).




Why You’ll Love It At Preply

An open, collaborative, dynamic and diverse culture;
A generous monthly allowance for lessons on Preply.com, Learning & Development budget and time off for your self-development;
A competitive financial package with equity, leave allowance and health insurance;
Not in Barcelona? We offer an attractive relocation package to join us in our Preply Barcelona Hub
Access to free mental health support platforms;
Access to Gympass-partnered wellness and gym centers throughout Spain to promote and support well-being and physical health;
The opportunity to unlock the potential of learners and tutors through language learning and teaching in 175 countries (and counting!).




Our Principles

Care to change the world - We are passionate about our work and care deeply about its impact to be life changing.
We do it for learners - For both Preply and tutors, learners are why we do what we do. Every day we focus on empowering tutors to deliver an exceptional learning experience.
Keep perfecting - To create an outstanding customer experience, we focus on simplicity, smoothness, and enjoyment, continually perfecting it as every detail matters.
Now is the time - In a fast-paced world, it matters how quickly we act. Now is the time to make great things happen.
Disciplined execution - What makes us disciplined is the excellence in our execution. We set clear goals, focus on what matters, and utilize our resources efficiently.
Dive deep - We leverage business acumen and curiosity to investigate disparities between numbers and stories, unlocking meaningful insights to guide our decisions.
Growth mindset - We proactively seek growth opportunities and believe today's best performance becomes tomorrow's starting point. We humbly embrace feedback and learn from setbacks.
Raise the bar - We raise our performance standards continuously, alongside each new hire and promotion. We build diverse and high-performing teams that can make a real difference.
Challenge, disagree and commit - We value open and candid communication, even when we don’t fully agree. We speak our minds, challenge when necessary, and fully commit to decisions once made.
One Preply - We prioritize collaboration, inclusion, and the success of our team over personal ambitions. Together, we support and celebrate each other's progress.




Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion

Preply is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment where people from all backgrounds can thrive. Different opinions and viewpoints are key ingredients in our success as a multicultural Ed-Tech company.

Preply will consider all applications for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, age or veteran status. Together, we are The World Class.

Show more

  • Conduct A/B tests analysis to evaluate the impact of changes in payment flows.
  • Provide actionable insights to reduce costs, increase payment success rates, and improve user satisfaction with payment-related services.
  • Identify trends and opportunities, providing actionable insights to support team initiatives.
  • Stay updated on industry trends, payment technologies, and competitive practices to inform strategic decisions.


What You Need To Succeed

  • At least 5 years' experience in Data Science, focusing on data analytics for product or payment teams.
  • Previous experience in a dynamic technology environment, preferably within payments, e-commerce, or the fintech space.
  • Proven ability to work with product teams, run A/B tests, and identify product and payment optimization opportunities.
  • Strong background in quantitative fields (e.g., statistics, mathematics).
  • Proficiency in one or more programming languages (e.g., SQL, Python).
  • An outcome-driven approach with a passion for problem-solving and exploring new ideas.
  • A creative mindset with a proactive attitude, along with stakeholder management and influencing skills;
  • Ability to create clear, insightful reports and dashboards.
  • Fluency in English and eager to work on a global product with a multicultural team.


Nice To Have

  • Familiarity with payment gateways, transaction processing, digital wallet systems and PSD2 or regional regulations.
  • Experience with Looker, Amplitude, Snowflake.
  • Experience with advanced statistical modeling, predictive analytics or machine learning.
  • Experience in digital businesses and checkout steps (B2B, B2C, B2B2C).


Why You’ll Love It At Preply

  • An open, collaborative, dynamic and diverse culture;
  • A generous monthly allowance for lessons on Preply.com, Learning & Development budget and time off for your self-development;
  • A competitive financial package with equity, leave allowance and health insurance;
  • Not in Barcelona? We offer an attractive relocation package to join us in our Preply Barcelona Hub
  • Access to free mental health support platforms;
  • Access to Gympass-partnered wellness and gym centers throughout Spain to promote and support well-being and physical health;
  • The opportunity to unlock the potential of learners and tutors through language learning and teaching in 175 countries (and counting!).


Our Principles

  • Care to change the world - We are passionate about our work and care deeply about its impact to be life changing.
  • We do it for learners - For both Preply and tutors, learners are why we do what we do. Every day we focus on empowering tutors to deliver an exceptional learning experience.
  • Keep perfecting - To create an outstanding customer experience, we focus on simplicity, smoothness, and enjoyment, continually perfecting it as every detail matters.
  • Now is the time - In a fast-paced world, it matters how quickly we act. Now is the time to make great things happen.
  • Disciplined execution - What makes us disciplined is the excellence in our execution. We set clear goals, focus on what matters, and utilize our resources efficiently.
  • Dive deep - We leverage business acumen and curiosity to investigate disparities between numbers and stories, unlocking meaningful insights to guide our decisions.
  • Growth mindset - We proactively seek growth opportunities and believe today's best performance becomes tomorrow's starting point. We humbly embrace feedback and learn from setbacks.
  • Raise the bar - We raise our performance standards continuously, alongside each new hire and promotion. We build diverse and high-performing teams that can make a real difference.
  • Challenge, disagree and commit - We value open and candid communication, even when we don’t fully agree. We speak our minds, challenge when necessary, and fully commit to decisions once made.
  • One Preply - We prioritize collaboration, inclusion, and the success of our team over personal ambitions. Together, we support and celebrate each other's progress.


Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion

Preply is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment where people from all backgrounds can thrive. Different opinions and viewpoints are key ingredients in our success as a multicultural Ed-Tech company.

Preply will consider all applications for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, age or veteran status. Together, we are The World Class.

Title: ML Engineer (m/f/x)
Description:
Job Description

We at sevdesk:

As an intuitive cloud accounting software, we empower founders, self-employed individuals, and small business owners to focus on what truly matters. Our product offers them a smart accounting tool to save time in their daily activities. As a company, we aim for excellence, continuously expand our horizons, and strive for daily improvement of our product and our daily work life. In pursuit of these goals, we rely on our strong culture, innovative spirit, and unwavering passion. In the future, we hope to count you among our dedicated team members.

Your Mission:

As a Machine Learning Engineer in our Data Team, you collaborate with data platform engineering and product development to align and integrate Data Science products. You provide consultancy and support to Data Scientists to create production-ready machine learning models.

Here's how you'll make an impact:


You handle the technical design and development of Data Science products, incorporating machine learning and software development best practices.
You ensure the scalability, reliability, and maintainability of cloud-based Data Science software.
You implement security and threat protection measures to protect our customers data.
You optimize MLOps/DevOps approaches, including CI/CD and automated testing, for fast provision and continual enhancement of machine learning models.
You develop and maintain monitoring and alarm systems, ensuring efficient performance and timely issue identification.
You enhance operational efficiency and cost-effectiveness of Data Science products in the cloud.


Your Qualification:


You possess a degree (or equivalent) in mathematics, a technical field, or a related discipline with relevant professional experience.
You demonstrate experience in overcoming challenges in Data Science product delivery and leading complex projects in cross-functional team settings to completion.
You have strong fundamentals in software architecture, design patterns, and algorithms, combined with a profound knowledge of machine learning, deep learning and statistical concepts.
You are proficient in Python, SQL/NoSQL, and in machine learning libraries like scikit-learn, pytorch, Hugging Face, etc.
You are skilled with software development tools and MLOps tools (see below “Our Tech Stack”).
You showcase expertise in cloud environments, especially AWS, with a solid understanding of the nuances of cloud services, and comfort with IaaC.


Our Tech Stack

AWS | Python | Dagster | Terraform | Dbt | Snowflake | Github | Containers | Traditional ML & GenAI models


Experience with these tools is a plus, but we value your ability to design and implement systems with similar tools and discuss design trade-offs in each product category, possibly suggesting improvements to our stack.


Job Requirements

Your sevdesk Experience

Drive Impact: Make meaningful contributions and help move initiatives forward across teams. Your input will be valued, and your work will have a direct influence on sevdesk's success.

Empowered Ownership: take charge of your work and projects with the expectation of making decisions independently, supported by a team that's there when you need guidance.

Competitive Compensation: Includes a stock option plan and company pension to reward your contributions.

Time to Recharge: 30 vacation days, 3 additional days for social engagement, plus 30 Workation days to work from anywhere in the EU.

Flexible Work Environment: We believe in working where you’re most productive, whether that’s at home or in the office. Our hybrid approach balances flexibility with in-person collaboration, fostering trust and strong teamwork when we come together.

Comprehensive Benefits: learning budget, bike leasing, monthly voucher of choice (Amazon, IKEA, Car Sharing, …), Amazon book flat, corporate discounts and more.

Team Vibes: Enjoy regular team offsites and quarterly events packed with networking and fun!

For more insights, visit us on Instagram



Contact:   Marc Riehle


Show more
